meta.title: The Cold War
meta.description: The superpower rivalry that shaped the modern world
meta.historical_context: For nearly half a century, two superpowers armed with nuclear weapons faced off across ideological lines. The Cold War shaped everything from space exploration to Third World revolutions, from cultural production to arms races. The conflict ended with Soviet collapse, but could have gone very differently.
meta.divergence_point: Critical moments when the Cold War could have turned hot, ended earlier, or concluded differently

joseph_stalin.name: Joseph Stalin
joseph_stalin.description: The paranoid dictator whose suspicions of the West helped launch the Cold War.

harry_truman.name: Harry S. Truman
harry_truman.description: The president who committed America to containing Soviet expansion worldwide.

mikhail_gorbachev.name: Mikhail Gorbachev
mikhail_gorbachev.description: The reformer whose attempts to save communism inadvertently ended the Soviet Union.

nuclear_war.title: The Final War: Nuclear Apocalypse
nuclear_war.description: What if the Cuban Missile Crisis escalated to nuclear war in 1962?
nuclear_war.divergence_description: A misunderstanding during the Cuban Missile Crisis leads to nuclear exchange between the US and USSR.

missiles_launched_1962.title: October 27, 1962
missiles_launched_1962.description: A Soviet submarine commander, believing war has begun, launches nuclear torpedoes. US retaliates. Within hours, ICBMs fly.
missiles_launched_1962.impact: Major cities in both superpowers are destroyed. Hundreds of millions die in the first hours.

nuclear_winter_1963.title: The Dark Years
nuclear_winter_1963.description: Nuclear winter sets in. Global temperatures drop. Crops fail worldwide. Billions face starvation.
nuclear_winter_1963.impact: Human civilization collapses. Most of humanity perishes over the next five years.

remnant_civilizations_1975.title: The Scattered Survivors
remnant_civilizations_1975.description: Only isolated communities in the Southern Hemisphere and remote regions survive. Global population is reduced by 90%.
remnant_civilizations_1975.impact: Humanity is set back centuries. The nuclear war becomes humanity's great filter.

consequences.short_term: Nuclear war kills billions. Civilization collapses globally.
consequences.long_term: Human population reduced to pre-industrial levels. Centuries of recovery ahead.
consequences.global_impact: The nuclear apocalypse nearly ends human civilization. Survivors build new societies from the ruins.

nuclear_war.present_day_status: Humanity slowly recovered from the brink of extinction. By 2025, global population has only reached 2 billion. Technology has been rebuilt but nuclear weapons are universally banned and their knowledge actively suppressed. The Great Death of 1962 defines all human culture and politics.

soviet_victory.title: The Red Dawn: Soviet Victory in the Cold War
soviet_victory.description: What if the Soviet Union won the Cold War through superior economic performance?
soviet_victory.divergence_description: Soviet economic reforms in the 1960s succeed. The USSR outcompetes the West economically and politically.

kosygin_reforms_1965.title: The Soviet Economic Miracle
kosygin_reforms_1965.description: Kosygin's market reforms are fully implemented. The Soviet economy becomes more efficient than central planning while maintaining socialist principles.
kosygin_reforms_1965.impact: Soviet living standards rise above Western levels by 1980. The socialist model gains credibility worldwide.

western_decline_1980.title: Crisis of Capitalism
western_decline_1980.description: Stagflation and social unrest plague Western democracies. Communist parties gain power in France and Italy.
western_decline_1980.impact: The West is on the defensive. Socialist movements grow globally.

global_socialism_2000.title: The Socialist Century
global_socialism_2000.description: By 2000, most of the world has adopted democratic socialism. Market economies are heavily regulated. Wealth inequality is minimal.
global_socialism_2000.impact: A world dominated by social democratic values. Capitalism survives only in diminished form.

consequences.short_term: Soviet economic reforms succeed. USSR wins the economic competition with capitalism.
consequences.long_term: Global shift toward democratic socialism. Market capitalism becomes marginalized.
consequences.global_impact: More egalitarian but possibly less innovative world. Different technological development path.

soviet_victory.present_day_status: The world is dominated by democratic socialist economies with strong workers' rights, universal healthcare, and limited wealth inequality. Innovation is slower but more equitably distributed. Environmental protection stronger. The Cold War ended with socialism's peaceful victory in the marketplace of ideas.

early_detente.title: The Peace Dividend: Early End to Cold War
early_detente.description: What if Stalin died earlier and Khrushchev's peaceful coexistence succeeded in the 1950s?
early_detente.divergence_description: Stalin dies in 1950. Khrushchev rises earlier and implements deep reforms. Genuine détente emerges in the 1950s.

stalin_death_1950.title: The Tyrant Falls
stalin_death_1950.description: Stalin dies three years earlier. Khrushchev consolidates power quickly and begins de-Stalinization immediately.
stalin_death_1950.impact: The Soviet Union reforms earlier and more thoroughly. The worst of the Cold War never happens.

geneva_accord_1955.title: True Peaceful Coexistence
geneva_accord_1955.description: Eisenhower and Khrushchev reach genuine accommodation. Nuclear arsenals are limited. Both sides accept spheres of influence.
geneva_accord_1955.impact: Cold War never becomes as dangerous. Arms race is limited. Resources go to development instead.

cooperative_space_program_1969.title: Apollo-Soyuz Moonshot
cooperative_space_program_1969.description: US and USSR reach the Moon together in a joint mission. Scientific cooperation becomes the norm.
cooperative_space_program_1969.impact: Cold War evolves into competition within cooperation. Proxy wars are avoided.

consequences.short_term: Cold War tensions ease in the 1950s. Arms race is limited. Proxy wars avoided.
consequences.long_term: Gradual convergence of systems. USSR reforms slowly toward democracy. West accepts more social welfare.
consequences.global_impact: Resources saved from arms race go to development. Earlier space exploration and scientific advance.

early_detente.present_day_status: The early détente led to gradual convergence of Soviet and Western systems. The USSR evolved into a social democratic federation by the 1980s. Without the intense Cold War, decolonization was less violent and development more rapid. The peace dividend accelerated human progress by decades.
